parameters: \pop[2]I enter the Triple R, and I'm immediately waved over by my friends.
\pop[2]Our usual table. At least, when we're planning for group outings.
\pop[2]Except, this time, something is new. Kyron is sitting with them.
\pop[2]That's a \c[14]really\c[0] good sign. He got in without any issues.
\pop[2]Suddenly, a wave of relief washes over me. Like, a tidal wave.
\pop[2]Weird how successfully doing the wrong thing could put me at ease.
\pop[2]But I guess that's how things are when the lines are so blurred.
\pop[2]There shouoldn't be any issue with Kyron living in the city like this.
\pop[2]With the protests approaching their climax, I hoped for equality.
\pop[3]Hey, Delta! We were just about to get started.
Sick outfit, Delta. You're killing it.
\pop[2]I do always try and look my best.
\pop[2]It was a special occasion too, after all.
\pop[4]I'm not so up to date on fashion, and stuff...
But I \c[14]do\c[0] think you look nice, if that means anything.
\i[5]"I think you look great. I'm kinda jealous."
\i[2]"Don't be hard on yourself. That outfit is pretty hot."
\i[6]"Yeah. You're definitely not up to date."
\i[5]"I think you look great. I'm kinda jealous."
It's basically just scraps from the colony.
Everything back there is a hand-me-down.
\pop[3]I can't imagine wearing someone else's clothes.
\i[2]"Don't be hard on yourself. That outfit is pretty hot."
\pop[4]Yeah, I guess it \c[14]does\c[0] make me look good.
But trust me, I look even better without it.
\pop[3]Oh come on, that was so basic.
\i[6]"Yeah. You're definitely not up to date."
\pop[4]You didn't have to agree with me, you know.
Gonna make me all self-conscious on my big day.
I'm surprised Taylor hasn't hit on you yet.
\pop[4]Always try to look my best, yeah.
But these are just hand-me-downs from the colony.
There isn't much time for fashion back home.
\pop[3]Hmm. Maybe we should take you clothes shopping.
You know, something to make you fit in a bit more.
No offense, but you don't exactly blend in like that.
\pop[2]I look over at Isaac, and he simply smirks.
\pop[4]Glad to see you all getting along so well.
I'm guessing you're less worried, now that we're here?
Until he walked through that door, it was all theory.
Not that I didn't trust you. But seeing it certainly helps.
\pop[4]So, I wanted to talk about a couple things while we were here.
I have an interview with \c[23]Argus\c[0] on Friday, before the bar.
He's not in the group chat, remember?
\pop[4]Can I join that, by the way?
\pop[4]Let's see how things go at The Wayfarer, first.
I'm a bit more worried when it comes to our chatroom.
They could monitor that. But not our real life conversations.
\pop[3]\c[23]Argus\c[0] \c[14]better\c[0] not be monitoring our group chat.
\pop[3]Yeah, don't want them to see your poor taste in memes.
Always manage to make me laugh.
I wanna see all the fun you have.
\pop[4]It's mostly just a place for them to bicker.
But entertainment is entertainment, after all.
\pop[4]Anyway, you were saying about this interview?
They kinda want me to move up the corporate ladder.
When I'm there, I'll have access to some of their computers.
\pop[4]I figured I'd take a deeper look into what's going on.
You know, if there's any heat or suspicion on our group.
At work, I can look pretty high up, but my sight is limited.
I figure if we failed, \c[23]Argus\c[0] would be here already.
Do you really need to risk snooping around like that?
\pop[4]Not really, but I was doing it for everyone else.
I'm certain that we're safe, but \c[14]they\c[0] were all paranoid.
\pop[3]Well, paranoia is the fear of something irrational.
With everything going on, I think it's fair to be scared.
Coming here helped, but I wouldn't mind a bit more safety.
\pop[4]That's why I figured I'd do it during my interview.
Then I can let you all know before we hit up The Wayfarer.
If it's not looking good, then we can stop this altogether.
\pop[3]Is all of this related to... You know...
\pop[3]That thing we talked about a few years ago.
Back when I made you that promise.
\pop[2]Isaac looks surprised, like he completely forgot.
\pop[3]Back when we first became friends, we were really close.
Isaac told me that one day he'd ask me for a promise.
And even if my gut said no, I had to play along.
He could get you to do anything he wants.
\pop[3]He does that all the time, anyway.
But he has yet to cash in on the promise.
\pop[2]But if my best friend asked for a promise, I'd probably help them.
\pop[2]Not a fan of using them as currency, and "cashing in" on them, though.
\pop[4]You know, that's not so different from the colonies.
We can give and take a lot more than money.
I've traded a few promises in my day.
\pop[4]Not really, it's just something we're all used to.
Especially when we have some special information.
We're so tight-knit, a lot of our visions intertwine.
\pop[3]Trading information based on visions? For favors?
That's one way to drop your score as fast as possible.
\pop[4]Well we don't have to worry about that kinda stuff out there.
The things you all fear? They're just second nature to us.
But I'm gonna guess this has to do with Isaac's vision?
\pop[4]Yes, but I'm not going to get into it any more than that.
Dante promised, but I still need to win the rest of you over.
\pop[3]Well, I'd still appreciate you checking in at \c[23]Argus\c[0] HQ.
Just because I promised, doesn't mean I can't be scared.
\pop[2]A few pieces start to connect in my mind, so I vocalize them.
\pop[2]At the nightclub, Dante revealed that Isaac's vision was positive.
\pop[2]Not only that, but it's tied to a promise that Dante made.
\pop[2]The promise to play along, and push through this whole ordeal.
\pop[2]That must mean Isaac's vision is related to all of this.
\pop[2]The end result must be positive. For all of us.
\pop[3]Yeah, but all that lock takes is a few shots of vodka.
Either way, you should've opened up with that, Isaac.
If you know it ends well, why make us worry?
\pop[4]Because it might not actually end well.
\pop[2]I notice Klace hasn't said much at all.
\pop[2]He has his diary with him again, though.
\pop[2]He slowly flips through the pages, like he's only half-there.
\pop[4]You all seem so confident that you've beaten \c[23]The System\c[0].
But in my vision, I'm a lot older, and still stuck on a colony.
\pop[4]So I figure it's only a matter of time until I get caught.
And that means you'll probably all go down, too.
\pop[4]Don't you think you could've told us this sooner?
\pop[4]Well, it's not like it came up until now.
I've only been around you like three times.
There's no reason to give up.
Both visions can play along with each other.
\pop[4]But I haven't even told you mine.
\pop[3]Well, let's say this all works out.
Equality for \c[10]zeros\c[0], and none of us get in trouble.
Wouldn't we all be free to leave and enter the city...?
\pop[3]Maybe you're just visiting friends who stayed behind.
So let's not write anything off just yet.
We should trust Isaac, and let him investigate.
\pop[4]But we might not know for years.
\pop[3]No, that's impossible. Look at the protests.
I think things will be decided real soon.
Kinda sick of feeling like my friends are pawns.
It's not like any of us asked to be part of this game.
\pop[4]It's going pretty good though, all things considered.
And \c[10]Cipher\c[0]'s phones weren't as secure as the one \c[14]I\c[0] made.
If everyone got \c[10]Cipher\c[0]'s version, they'd already be caught.
\pop[4]But if \c[23]Argus\c[0] steps in to offer them? Then it's a win-win.
We just have to hope that it happens soon.
\pop[3]True. Maybe it's for the best that \c[10]Cipher\c[0]'s plan was put to a stop.
Gives them time to regroup and figure out what they did wrong.
Either way, I think this'll all be decided within a week or two.
\pop[3]Yeah, the anime convention isn't too far away.
\pop[3]Well, I doubt they chose it because of that.
\pop[3]I'm not even sure that \c[10]Hermes\c[0] said it would be "during" the convention.
\pop[3]It was a pretty vague timeline they offered. Just something about "the new year".
\pop[4]A lot of people will be downtown, though.
Blending into the crowd might be a part of their plan.
\pop[3]I guess we just have to wait and see.
But I definitely think we're gonna come out on top.
Whether from \c[23]Argus\c[0], or from \c[10]Cipher\c[0], those \c[10]zeros\c[0] are gonna get phones.
\pop[2]Yeah, I guess waiting is all we can do.
\pop[2]\c[10]Zeros\c[0] protesting in the town square, actively starving...
\pop[2]A mysterious corporation, not stepping in to help out...
\pop[2]And a rebel organization, threatening to help out \c[14]for\c[0] them.
\pop[2]\c[23]Argus\c[0] doesn't have to negotiate with the \c[10]zeros\c[0]. It goes against their ethos.
\pop[2]If \c[10]Cipher\c[0] takes their time with this ultimatum, then \c[10]zeros\c[0] will just start dying in our streets.
\pop[2]I certainly picked the best time to start my new life...
